meanings.definition: To be exhausted or worn out.
meanings.sent1: After running the marathon, I was completely scouthered.
meanings.sent2: She scouthered herself after a long day of work.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy scouthered around the house, looking for a cozy spot to nap.
meanings.sent4: The old car scouthered along the road, barely able to keep up with the traffic.
meanings.sent5: The students were scouthered after studying for hours without a break.

meanings.definition: To be completely soaked or drenched.
meanings.sent1: The sudden rainstorm scouthered us on our way home.
meanings.sent2: He scouthered himself in the pool during the swimming competition.
meanings.sent3: The playful kids scouthered each other with water balloons in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The waterfall scouthered the rocks below with its powerful flow.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter was scouthered by the burst pipe while trying to put out the fire.

meanings.sent1: The team was scouthered by their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: She felt scouthered by the amount of work waiting for her.
meanings.sent3: The little ant scouthered under the weight of the giant crumb.
meanings.sent4: The army was scouthered by the unexpected attack from the enemy forces.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was scouthered by the vastness of the desert stretching before him.
